moves: 1. d4 Nf6 2. c4 e6 3. Nc3 Bb4 4. e3 b6 5. Qf3
comment:
This move co
ntraddicts the strategical principles indicated by the theory. Since Turn knew
that Mikenas had a deep theoretical preparation, he decided this line of play
in order to surprise the opponent.

moves: 1. d4 Nf6 2. c4 e6 3. Nc3 Bb4 4. e3 b6 5. Qf3 Nc6 6. Bd3
comment:
A bit inaccurate. The
following continuation would have lead to interesting complications: 6. Bd2
Bb7 7. Qg3 O-O 8. d5

moves: 1. d4 Nf6 2. c4 e6 3. Nc3 Bb4 4. e3 b6 5. Qf3 Nc6 6. Bd3 Bb7 7. Qg3 Bd6
comment:
White hoped in the reply 7. .. 0-0
8.Ne2 with initiative on the kingside after 9.e4.

moves: 1. d4 Nf6 2. c4 e6 3. Nc3 Bb4 4. e3 b6 5. Qf3 Nc6 6. Bd3 Bb7 7. Qg3 Bd6 8. f4
comment:
In fact, the capture
8. Qxg7 after 8... Rg8 9. Qh6 Rxg2 would have given a very promising position
to Black.

moves: 1. d4 Nf6 2. c4 e6 3. Nc3 Bb4 4. e3 b6 5. Qf3 Nc6 6. Bd3 Bb7 7. Qg3 Bd6 8. f4 g5
comment:
An energetic reply, revealing Mikenas character in that
period: enthusiasm, courage and imagination. Which is the general strategy of
the young people: attack, and don't care about possible losses.

moves: 1. d4 Nf6 2. c4 e6 3. Nc3 Bb4 4. e3 b6 5. Qf3 Nc6 6. Bd3 Bb7 7. Qg3 Bd6 8. f4 g5 9. Nf3 gxf4 10. exf4 Rg8 11. Qf2 Nxd4
comment:
The right continuation even if comes from intuition
rather than calculation. The consequences of 11... Rxg2 12. Qxg2 Nxd4 13. Qg7
Nxf3+ 14. Kf2 were unclear. Not even convincing 11... Nh5 12. Bxh7

moves: 1. d4 Nf6 2. c4 e6 3. Nc3 Bb4 4. e3 b6 5. Qf3 Nc6 6. Bd3 Bb7 7. Qg3 Bd6 8. f4 g5 9. Nf3 gxf4 10. exf4 Rg8 11. Qf2 Nxd4 12. Nxd4
comment:
When problems are complex the right reply is not always found. Perhaps better
was 12. Qxd4 although even in this case Black can keep some more possibilites
in view of the endgame. For example: 12... Bc5 13. Qe5 Rxg2 14. Ne4 Bxe4 15.
Bxe4 Ng4 16. Qh8+ Ke7 17. Qxd8+ Rxd8 18. Ne5 Bb4+ 19. Kf1 Rf2+ 20. Kg1 Re2 and
the position and the pawns are an adequate compensation for the sacrificed
material.

moves: 1. d4 Nf6 2. c4 e6 3. Nc3 Bb4 4. e3 b6 5. Qf3 Nc6 6. Bd3 Bb7 7. Qg3 Bd6 8. f4 g5 9. Nf3 gxf4 10. exf4 Rg8 11. Qf2 Nxd4 12. Nxd4 Rxg2 13. Qf1 Bc5
comment:
A serious mistake would have been 13... Ng4
for 14. Be4 Qh4+ 15.Kd1 Nf2+ 16. Kc2 and the attack vanishes.

moves: 1. d4 Nf6 2. c4 e6 3. Nc3 Bb4 4. e3 b6 5. Qf3 Nc6 6. Bd3 Bb7 7. Qg3 Bd6 8. f4 g5 9. Nf3 gxf4 10. exf4 Rg8 11. Qf2 Nxd4 12. Nxd4 Rxg2 13. Qf1 Bc5 14. Nf3
comment:
Again an inaccurate move which will cost material. 14. Nce2 was relatively
better but after 14... Ng4 Black's attack would be irresistible.

moves: 1. d4 Nf6 2. c4 e6 3. Nc3 Bb4 4. e3 b6 5. Qf3 Nc6 6. Bd3 Bb7 7. Qg3 Bd6 8. f4 g5 9. Nf3 gxf4 10. exf4 Rg8 11. Qf2 Nxd4 12. Nxd4 Rxg2 13. Qf1 Bc5 14. Nf3 Rf2 15. Qxf2 Bxf2+ 16. Kxf2 Ng4+ 17. Kg3 Bxf3 18. Kxf3 Qh4 19. Be4
